Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= act of asking for something
= particle marking a proposition as not true

= action by which humans meet other humans that are travelling from one location to another ► either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ often extended to describe certain events that happen in people's lives
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: length of days; hence: = an extended period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= causative action by which deities cause humans to feel happiness
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: to be shaken; hence: = state in which humans are affected by difficult circumstances and feel worried and concerned
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= offspring of human beings, ◄ literally depicted as the fruit of the womb, as if it were a plant; ≈ regarded as a blessing from God

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: to bend; hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds in order to achieve an evil purpose
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which humans can complete a certain activity successfully

literally: to make (someone) shoulder; hence, possibly: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to lie flat on the ground ► so that they can place their foot on their shoulder or neck as a sign of victory
literally: to put shoulder; hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to turn around in order to move away from the place they were facing earlier
= relatively thin piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibers, linen, or reeds; ► especially used as tent cord or bowstring
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: to be, become high; hence: = processs by which humans or deities acquire an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
